intro: Cleome brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stemmed spider flower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Cleomaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 3 feet and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its foliage consists of alternate, ovate to lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Cleome brachypoda is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in full sun to partial shade.
